August 23, 1956
In addition. Active members with radio stations may use the facilities of
the NAEB Radio Network upon payment of an annual assessment fee. The Network
distributes approximately eight hours of programming, by tape recording, weekly,
to members subscribing to its service. This fee is also based on power (with the
same power classifications as membership) and a new station does not have to pay
the full fee until the third year it is in the Network. The fees ares
1st year
$400.00
250.00
150.00
2nd year
$600.00
375.00
225.00
Class A
Class B
Class C
Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to and from Net~
work Headquarters here in Urbans, Illinois. Still even a Class A station
paying its full third-year rate is paying only a little over $2.00 an hour far
better than 400 hours of programming from the Network in a year. This is about
the most inexpensive programing a station can do.
If, after looking over the materials which we shall send you, you have further
questions, we shall be most happy to answer them.
Sincerely,
Harold E. Hill
Associate Director
